information.01:
This device is a Raspberry Pi serving these web pages which display sensor inputs, and controls various outputs.

As well as these pages, this server generates two dynamic JSON files which provide the data for the control results and sensor table. These are available at:
information.02: This web software has been created by Bernard Czenkusz using the Python framework skipole.py. Further details of the framework can be found at: skipole.bitbucket.io The project development repository is here: https://bitbucket.org/skipole/rempi
information.03:
To set individual outputs send a GET request to set_output with the output name and value fields.  You will also need to send this unit's access username and password, so for example using curl:

curl "http://username:password@host/set_output?name=outputname&value=outputvalue"

Where host is generally the ip address of the pi, outputname and outputvalue should be the actual name and value to set. This should cause the appropriate output to be set, and a JSON array of the name:value should be returned. If an empty array is returned, something is wrong.

For boolean outputs use 'true' and 'false' as values rather than the more human readable values such as 'Off' and 'On'.
